stimulusHtml:
Respond to parts A, B, and all subparts.

(a) The diagram below shows the cycling of carbon.

features.html: Write your answers in the spaces provided. Refer to the figure or diagram to answer the question. Where explanation or discussion is required, support your answers with relevant information and/or specific examples.

stimulusHtml: (i) Identify a process shown in the diagram that removes carbon from the atmosphere.

features.html: Write your answers in the spaces provided. Refer to the figure or diagram to answer the question. Where explanation or discussion is required, support your answers with relevant information and/or specific examples.

stimulusHtml: (ii) Identify a process shown in the diagram that sequesters carbon from the atmosphere for a geological period of time.

features.html: Write your answers in the spaces provided. Refer to the figure or diagram to answer the question. Where explanation or discussion is required, support your answers with relevant information and/or specific examples.

stimulusHtml: (iii) Based on the diagram, explain how the combustion of fossil fuels has led to an imbalance in the carbon cycle.

features.html: Write your answers in the spaces provided. Refer to the figure or diagram to answer the question. Where explanation or discussion is required, support your answers with relevant information and/or specific examples.

stimulusHtml: (iv) Explain the role of decomposition in the carbon cycle.

features.html: Write your answers in the spaces provided. Refer to the figure or diagram to answer the question. Where explanation or discussion is required, support your answers with relevant information and/or specific examples.

stimulusHtml: (b) Scientists are interested in researching how carbon dioxide in the oceans is affecting its pH. They design a laboratory experiment in which they inject different concentrations of carbon dioxide into saltwater tanks containing calcium carbonate shells. The tanks were kept at the same, constant temperature. After several days, the scientists measured the pH of the saltwater tanks and observed its effects on the calcium carbonate shells.

features.html: Write your answers in the spaces provided. Refer to the figure or diagram to answer the question. Where explanation or discussion is required, support your answers with relevant information and/or specific examples.

stimulusHtml: (i) Identify the independent variable in this experiment.

features.html: Write your answers in the spaces provided. Refer to the figure or diagram to answer the question. Where explanation or discussion is required, support your answers with relevant information and/or specific examples.

stimulusHtml: (ii) Describe a control group that could be used in this experiment.

features.html: Write your answers in the spaces provided. Refer to the figure or diagram to answer the question. Where explanation or discussion is required, support your answers with relevant information and/or specific examples.

stimulusHtml: (iii) Explain the effect of carbon dioxide on the pH of the oceans.

features.html: Write your answers in the spaces provided. Refer to the figure or diagram to answer the question. Where explanation or discussion is required, support your answers with relevant information and/or specific examples.

stimulusHtml: (iv) Describe the effect of water temperature on the amount of dissolved gases in water.

features.html: Write your answers in the spaces provided. Refer to the figure or diagram to answer the question. Where explanation or discussion is required, support your answers with relevant information and/or specific examples.

stimulusHtml: (v) Describe how the results of the experiment would change if the temperature of the tanks was decreased.

features.html: Write your answers in the spaces provided. Refer to the figure or diagram to answer the question. Where explanation or discussion is required, support your answers with relevant information and/or specific examples.

stimulusHtml: (vi) Describe how a decrease in ocean pH can affect marine organisms.

features.html: Write your answers in the spaces provided. Refer to the figure or diagram to answer the question. Where explanation or discussion is required, support your answers with relevant information and/or specific examples.
